alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 4:41AM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches at lower pass levels, and up to 3 to 4 feet at higher passes and upper slopes. * WHERE...Camas Prairie and the Idaho mountains north of the Snake Basin. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is a long duration snow event with multiple periods of heavy snow. The heaviest snow will fall through this morning, and again Monday night and Tuesday morning as a cold front moves through. There could be lulls this afternoon and during the day on Monday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; West Central Mountains
